intro: Boechera stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. This perennial plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. Its small, white flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces rounded, hairy seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. Boechera stricta is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
